main_definition: A term referring to special offers or discounts, commonly used in the context of television programs or retail items.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Special promotions for television shows targeted at children.
meanings_and_examples.example: Cartoon Network's 'Toonami' block offers specials with exclusive episodes and characters.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Discounted or unique items available only for a limited time in stores, usually aimed at attracting customers.
meanings_and_examples.example: A store might offer special clothing lines during holiday seasons to increase sales.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Specifically tailored deals or packages that cater to the preferences of a particular group of people.
meanings_and_examples.example: Hotels may have specials for families, offering discounts on rooms and activities during school holidays.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in businesses to denote products or services with additional benefits or features that set them apart from standard offerings.
meanings_and_examples.example: A smartphone manufacturer may introduce a 'Special Edition' model with extra camera capabilities and design enhancements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of online platforms, specials can refer to limited-time content or features exclusive to premium members.
meanings_and_examples.example: A streaming service might release special episodes of a popular series exclusively for its subscribers who have an annual subscription.
